paragraphs.text: Obama should show black lives matter by hosting relatives of those killed by cops at his State of the Union.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Tuesday at President Obama's penultimate State of the Union address
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Obama points for effect at someone sitting with the First Lady as her guest
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: , every single guest around her should be a family member of someone killed by a police officer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I want to see Michelle Obama sandwiched between Erica Garner - whose father, Eric Garner, was killed by an NYPD officer using an illegal chokehold- and Tamir Rice's 14-year-old sister
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who was tackled and shackled by police when trying to help her dying 12-year-old brother
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I want to see Leslie McSpadden, Michael Brown's mother there tonight, and a relative of Tasha Thomas, John Crawford's now-deceased girlfriend
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who was interrogated by the same police department who'd just killed the father of her children for shopping at Wal Mart
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Let America look upon the elder Michael Brown, Kadiatou Diallo (Amadou Diallo's mother), Constance Malcolm (Ramarley Graham's mother), Sylvia Palmer (Akai Gurley's mother) or any of the thousands of relatives of the 1,100 or so Americans killed by police in 2014
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This of course will never happen
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's what I want
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama should use the political theatre of his "Skutniks"- the humans used to give a face to presidential pet problems since Ronald Reagan invited Lenny Skutnik to the State of the Union in 1982 - to focus American's attention squarely on the loss of human life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: cops kill black civilians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: President Obama wants us to believe that he thinks black life matters
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it's not enough for him to form a task force on 21 century policing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: task forces and commissions are where serious reforms go to be forgotten
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One police shooting victim's family member up in his box with a nice cop like Richmond, California Police Chief Chris Magnus(who famously held up a #BlackLivesMatters sign) is not enough
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We don't need a black kid-white cop hug moment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the President paired up a black victim of racism with kindly white folks at his "beer summit" in 2009
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: it was a disaster - at best a distraction, and at worst a prevarication that racism is anecdotal and not systematic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: President Obama is serious about showing black and brown life matters in this country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he's made some progress showing this overseas by winding down the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, though not so much by employing drone warfare in Pakistan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: - he needs to go big at the State of the Union
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He's taken on black lives falling victim to gun violence at his annual address before by inviting the parents of Hidaya Pendleton, a black Chicago teenager who was killed in 2013 shortly after performing at Obama's second inaugural
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But as Commander in Chief, with all those black folks at his side, Obama could challenge the mortal violence the state itself wages against its citizens through the local police and say to them: Enough
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ronald Reagan, whom Barack Obama uses as an example for how to sell himself as president, used Lenny Skutnik as an example of how"we saw again the spirit of American heroism at its finest,"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: after Skutnik jumped into icy water of the Potomac River to help the drowning after a plane crash
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: are not the kin of those killed by police violence also displaying "American heroism at its finest" in helping those who can't breathe?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is women like Tawanda Jones who are creating a more perfect union
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: she boldly speaks out about her brother being killed by police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even when dissent is under attack and Fox News broadcasts lies about her
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Erica Garner visits the site where two NYPD cops were killed to offer her condolences, she is saving the union
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Every time a woman like Michael Brown's mother calls for non-violence - when she could instead, understandably, lash out with a fraction of the hatred which killed her son- she is keeping the nation from ripping itself apart and acting with the kind of American heroism that presidents should applaud loudly and publicly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Skutnik helped save one woman
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The black women who bury their sons and husbands and seek to change the systems that caused their deaths may save countless of lives - and maybe even the soul of the nation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Black Lives Matters movement is a testament that, once again, black Americans are being called upon to force all Americans to examine our addiction to the violence and militarism that oppresses everyone in different ways
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Our first black president, riding an 18 month approval rating high, could choose to do some of that himself tonight, by acknowledging those left behind when black lives are ended by the state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: who still choose to use their grief to effect positive change
